data.title: Urey, Harold Clayton, 1893
data.text:
Harold Clayton Urey

Dates

April 29, 1893 – January 5, 1981

Authorized Form of Name

Urey, Harold Clayton, 1893-1981

Additional Forms of Names

Urey, H. C. (Harold Clayton), 1893-1981

Urey, Harold C. (Harold Clayton), 1893-1981

Biography

Abstract

Harold Urey was Emeritus Professor of Chemistry at University of California, San Diego (1970-1981). Other institutional affiliations included University of Chicago, Columbia University, and Johns Hopkins University. His research interests included entropy of gases, atomic structure, absorption spectra and structure of molecules, discovery of deuterium, properties and separation of isotopes, exchange reactions, measurement of paleotemperature, and chemical problems of the origin of the earth, meteorites, moon and solar system.

April 29, 1893Birth, Walkerton (Ind.).

1917Obtained BS in Zoology, University of Montana, Missoula (Mont.).

1918 – 1919Research Chemist, Barrett Chemical Company.

1919 – 1921Instructor in Chemistry, University of Montana.

1923Obtained PhD in Chemistry, University of California, Berkeley, Berkeley (Calif.).

1923 – 1924American-Scandinavian Foundation Fellow, University of Copenhagen.

1924 – 1929Associate in Chemistry, Johns Hopkins University, Baltimore (Md.).

1929 – 1945Associate Professor of Chemistry (1929-1934); Professor of Chemistry (1934-1945); and Executive Officer, Department of Chemistry (1939-1942), Columbia University, New York (N.Y.).

1933 – 1940Editor, Journal of Chemical Physics.

1934Awarded Nobel Prize in Chemistry "for his discovery of heavy hydrogen".

1935Member, National Academy of Sciences.

1940 – 1941Member, Committee on Uranium, National Defense Research Committee.

1941 – 1942Member, Section on Uranium, Office of Scientific Research and Development.

1942 – 1945Member, Executive Committee (1942-1945) and Program Chief (1942), Section S-1, Office of Scientific Research and Development.

1942 – 1945Project Leader, Columbia SAM Laboratories, Manhattan Project.

1945 – 1958Distinguished Service Professor of Chemistry (1945-1952) and Martin A. Reyerson Distinguished Service Professor of Chemistry (1952-1958), Institute for Nuclear Studies, University of Chicago, Chicago (Ill.).

1946 – 1951Vice Chair, Emergency Committee of Atomic Scientists.

1956 – 1957George Eastman Visiting Professor, Oxford University.

1958 – 1981Professor-at-Large of Chemistry (1958-1970) and Emeritus Professor of Chemistry (1970-1981), University of California, San Diego, La Jolla (San Diego, Calif.).

1964Awarded National Medal of Science.

January 5, 1981Death, La Jolla (San Diego, Calif.).

Occupation

Physical chemist.
